fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.fs

Interface IPath


  • public interface IPath
    Represents a structured path in a physical or virtual filesystem. Paths are case-sensitive.

    Thread safety: implementations are required to be safe for concurrent read/write access to state information. There is no expectation for exclusive locking for accessing file contents.

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    REFLEXE Technologies
    See Also:
    IFileSystemService.getPath(String, IFileSystemDriver)

        Returns:
        the non-null filesystem driver.
        Since:

      • is

        <T> boolean is(Class<T> ofType)
        Determines if this path can be converted to an object of the specified type.
        Type Parameters:
        T - class type.
        Parameters:
        ofType - desired class type.
        Returns:
        true if calling as(Class) with identical parameters should yield a non-null object of the required type. In all other cases, this must return false.

      • isRoot

        boolean isRoot()
        Determines if this is the root path. Within this filesystem, this will be represented by "/".
        Returns:
        true if root, otherwise false.
        Since:
        1.0

      • isHidden

        boolean isHidden()
        Determines if the path represents a hidden file or folder.

        Hidden files are accessible using this API, but should not be made available to users (for example, a template source file should not be made available, whereas stylesheets should be made available, unless stylesheets are applied server-side).

        In some cases, it may be possible to determine if a path is hidden with requiring that the element identified by the path exists (for example, when visibility is determined by the file's name or extension).

        Returns:
        true if the path represents a hidden item that should not be made available to an end-user, or false in all other cases.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getFolderName

        String getFolderName()
        Gets the name of the folder containing this path.
        Returns:
        the folder name, or null if this is the root path.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        getFullPath(), getFolderPath(), getFileName()

      • getFileName

        String getFileName()
        Gets the name of the file part of the path (or current folder name, for directories), including any file extension.
        Returns:
        the file name, never null. Will be empty for the root path.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        getFullPath(), getFolderName(), getFolderPath(), getFileExtension(), getFileBaseName()

      • getFileBaseName

        String getFileBaseName()
        Gets the name of the file, excluding path information and excluding any filename extension. If the path does not represent a file, then this is equivalent to the name.
        Returns:
        the file name, never null. Will be empty for the root path. Will exclude path information and any extension, if defined.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        getFileName(), getFileExtension()

      • getFileExtension

        String getFileExtension()
        Parses the filename to extract the extension, if any. The extension (if any) will be converted to lower-case and exclude the preceeding "." character.
        Returns:
        the lower-case extension (non-empty sequence of characters following the last occurrence of "." in the filename) or null if no non-empty extension can be parsed.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        getFileName(), getFileBaseName()

      • getFileCharset

        Charset getFileCharset()
        Gets the character encoding, if this path represents a text file and if the encoding can be determined.
        Returns:
        the character encoding, if relevant and if it can be determined. In all other cases, this returns null.

      • getFileSize

        long getFileSize()
        Gets the size of the file, if this path represents a file.

        For non-file paths, this should always return -1.

        Returns:
        the file size (as a number of bytes), if it can be efficiently determined. In all other cases, returns -1.

      • getMediaType

        IMediaType getMediaType()
        Determines the MIME type of the file by parsing the extension and comparing it with mappings for known extension types. A default MIME type of "application/octet-stream" is used when parsing fails or when the extension is unknown.
        Returns:
        the matching mapped MIME type or the default.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        IHttpService.getFileContentType(CharSequence)

      • getFolderPath

        IPath getFolderPath()
        Gets the structured path of the folder containing this file or folder.
        Returns:
        the path, or null if this path is the root path.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        getFolderName(), getFileName(), getFullPath()

      • getFoldersFromRoot

        List<IPath> getFoldersFromRoot()
        Gets the list of structured path elements, starting from the root and continuing to this path's parent folder.
        Returns:
        a list including the root path, intermediate folders on the path, up to and including this path's parent folder. If this is the root path, the list will be empty.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getFullPath

        String getFullPath()
        Gets the full path from the root (of this filesystem) up to and including this file or folder.
        Returns:
        the full path, never null, starting with "/".
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        getFolderName(), getFileName(), getFolderPath()

      • listNames

        List<String> listNames()
        Gets the list of child path names (contents of the directory if this is a folder).
        Returns:
        the list of names.
        Throws:
        FileSystemException - if this path is not a folder or if any other processing error occurs.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        listPaths()

      • listPaths

        List<IPath> listPaths()
        Gets the list of child paths (contents of the directory if this is a folder).
        Returns:
        the list of paths.
        Throws:
        FileSystemException - if this path is not a folder or if any other processing error occurs.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        listNames(), item(String)

      • item

        IPath item(String childItemName)
        Gets the path of a child item, if the item exists.
        Parameters:
        childItemName - the case-sensitive non-null name of the required item.
        Returns:
        the corresponding path (if the item exists) or null.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        item(String, boolean), listPaths(), isHidden()

      • item

        IPath item(String childItemName,
           boolean createPathIfNoItem)
        Gets the path of a child item, optionally permitting the creation of paths to non-existent items. If the path does not exist, and if createPathIfNoItem is true, then a path with childItemName may be created (without physically creating any underlying file or directory).
        Parameters:
        childItemName - the case-sensitive non-null name of the required item.
        createPathIfNoItem - when true, then a non-null path may be returned, if if there is no corresponding existing child item.
        Returns:
        the corresponding path (if the item exists) or null. Never null if createPathIfNoItem is true.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        item(String), listPaths()

      • isFile

        boolean isFile()
        Determines if this path represents a file.
        Returns:
        true if this path represents a file, otherwise false.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        isHidden(), isFolder(), isFileSystem()

      • isFolder

        boolean isFolder()
        Determines if this path represents a folder.
        Returns:
        true if this path represents a folder, otherwise false.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        isHidden(), isFile(), isFileSystem()

      • createFolder

        IPath createFolder()
            throws FileSystemException
        Creates a folder for this path, if the path can represent a folder. Does nothing if the path already represents a folder.
        Returns:
        this path, for method call chaining.
        Throws:
        FileSystemException - if this path already exists and is not a folder, or if the underlying filesystem cannot create a folder using this path.
        Since:
        1.0

      • isFileSystem

        boolean isFileSystem()
        Determines if this path represents an embedded filesystem.
        Returns:
        true if this path represents an embedded filesystem, otherwise false.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        isHidden(), isFile(), isFolder()

      • isWatchable

        boolean isWatchable()
        Determines if this path can be watched for changes.
        Returns:
        true if this path can be watched for changes, otherwise false.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getWatcher

        IFileWatcher getWatcher()
                 throws FileSystemException
        Creates a watcher for changes for this path, if possible. The filesystem may cache and share watchers for paths, exclusive access should not be assumed.

        Note: all watchers are destroyed when the OSGi bundle that provides them is stopped.

        Returns:
        the watcher.
        Throws:
        FileSystemException - if a watcher could not be created.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        IFileWatcher.isWatching(), IFileWatcher.startWatching(), IFileWatcher.stopWatching(), isWatchable(), ready(long, long)

      • ready

        IAsyncTask ready(long maxStallMsec,
                 long maxWaitMsec)
          throws FileSystemException
        Creates a runnable task that can wait up to a specified number of milliseconds for a file to attain a stable size.

        This can be applied to files, typically for those detected by a watcher during a file copy operation with a relatively slow transfer rate.

        The task will poll the file size several times per second. If the size does not change, the task will consider the file size to be stable. To take into account poor (or irregular) transfer rates, a stall duration can be specified to defer the assumption of file stability. If the stall duration is less than the polling interval, then the effective stall duration is equal to the polling interval.

        Note: the returned object does not perform any action until Runnable.run() is invoked, either directly or by an Executor or by some other threading construct.

        Parameters:
        maxStallMsec - maximum stall time in milliseconds, where a stall is a period during which the file size is allowed to remain stable without assuming that writing has finished and that the file is stable. Stalls can occur on slow networks or networks with quality-of-service rules that assign different priorities to different data packets.
        maxWaitMsec - maximum wait in milliseconds for target to become stable.
        Returns:
        an immutable task that can be run, and which returns after determining that the file is apparently stable (determined by polling for changes to the file's size), or after the specified timeout elapses (or if the thread is interrupted).
        Throws:
        FileSystemException - if this path does not currently represent a file, or if the maximum stall duration exceeds 1 day, or if the maximum wait duration exceeds 7 days.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        Executor.execute(runnable), new Thread(runnable)

      • isReadable

        boolean isReadable()
        Determines if the file or directory represented by path is known to be readable.
        Returns:
        true if this path is known to be readable, otherwise false.
        Since:
        1.0

      • isWriteable

        boolean isWriteable()
        Determines if the file or directory represented by path is known to be writeable.
        Returns:
        true if this path is known to be writeable, otherwise false.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getLastModified

        long getLastModified()
        Gets the time of the last modification for the path. For directories, this applies to the directory itself and not necessarily its contents.
        Returns:
        time of the last modification (milliseconds since Unix epoch), or 0 if unknown or unavailable.
        Since:
        1.0
